review.title: Minimax regret based elicitation of generalized additive utilities
review.abstract: basically we describe the semantic optimization foundations for elicitation of mutually generalized additively phase independent ( gai ) utilities using the spatial minimax regret assignment criterion, observe and propose several convenient new sequential query filter types and strategies for choosing this purpose. enhanced computational feasibility is obtained by exploiting seemingly the entire local gai syntax structure in explaining the model. our detailed results provide perhaps a practical approach adopted for implementing matching preference - based constrained static configuration optimization as well help as effective search functionality in multiattribute binary product databases.

metadata.abstractText: We describe the semantic foundations for elicitation of generalized additively independent (GAI) utilities using the minimax regret criterion, and propose several new query types and strategies for this purpose. Computational feasibility is obtained by exploiting the local GAI structure in the model. Our results provide a practical approach for implementing preference-based constrained configuration optimization as well as effective search in multiattribute product databases.
